TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Take some substance in a test tube.
Take some substance in a China dish.
Add some Alcohol.
Add some Ferric Chloride ([cml]FeCl3[/cml]).
Violet colouration:Presence of Phenols.
No violet colouration:Absence of Phenols.
Add some Methanol.
Add some Borsche's reagent.
Place it in waterbath for boiling.
A yellowish orange ppt : Presence of Aldehydes or ketones.
A yellowish orange ppt : Absence of Aldehydes or ketones.
Add some [cml]NaHCO3[/cml].
Shake it well.
Brisk effervescence with the liberation of [cml]CO2[/cml]:Presence of Acid.
No brisk effervescence with the liberation of [cml]CO2[/cml]:Absence of Acid.
Add some HCl.
Keep it in ice cold condition for some time.
Add Sodium Nitrite solution dropwise into the test tube.
Rapid foaming : presence of Primary Aliphatic Amines.
Add Sodium Nitrate solution dropwise into the test tube.
No rapid foaming : Absence of Amines.
Add some NaOH.
Substence dissolved : Presence of Acidic substances.
Boil it well.
Introduce a red litmus paper to test ammonia evolved, it turns to blue.
Absence of amides.
Introduce a red litmus paper to test ammonia evolved, it turns to blue.
Add some HCl.
White crystalline ppt : Presence of Aromatic Amides.
Ammonia is evolved but no white ppt after adding HCl : Presence of Aliphatic Amides.
Add some Schiff's reagent.
Shake it well.
Violet color developed within 2 minutes : Presence of Aldehydes.
No violet color developed : Absence of Aldehydes.
take some component in a china dish.
place the china dish on to burner.
place the funnel in the china dish.
a smog will appear in the funnel after the burning.
Absence of Dicarboxylic Acid.
White shiny needles are deposited on the sides of the funnel : Presence of Dicarboxylic Acid.
Add some Tollens reagent.
Boil it well.
Black ppt : Presence of Aldehydes.
Absence of Aldehydes.
Add some Sodium Nitroprusside.
Wine red color : presence of Methyl Ketons.
no wine red color : Absence of Methyl Ketons.
notext.
Add some [cml]NaHSO3[/cml].
White crystalline ppt : Presence of Aldehydes.
No white crystalline ppt : Absence of Aldehydes.
Add some Hydrogen Peroxide.
boil it well.
Add some [cml]FeCl3[/cml].
Magenta Colouration : Presence of Aromatic Primary Amide.
No magenta Colouration : Absence of Aromatic Primary Amide.
Add some [cml]H2SO4[/cml].
Add some Resorcinol.
Heat it well and keep it cool for some time.
Pour the coold mixture into the beaker containing NaOH.
Absence of dicarboxylic acid.
A red solution with intense green fluorescence : Presence of dicarboxylic acid.
Add some Benzoyl Chloride.
Close the boiling tube using coark.
Shake the boiling tube well.
White ppt is formed : Presence of Aromatic Amines.
No white ppt : Absence of Aromatic Amines.
Add some diluted HCl.
Add some [cml]NaNO2[/cml].
Add some 2 naphthol in NaOH.
keep the mixture in ice cold condition.
Orange-red dye : Presence of aromatic amines.
No Orange-red dye : Absence of aromatic amines.
Heat the substance.
The substance will dissolve, and ammonia will evolve. Use litmus paper test.
Heat the substance again, it will get dry.
Heat the mixture again and keep it cool.
Add some [cml]CuSO4[/cml].
Violet colouration : Presence of diamide.
No violet colouration : Absence of diamide.
Keep the mixture in a test tube stand.
In a new test tube take some Aniline.
Keep the mixture in ice cold condition.
Add few drops of Saturated Sodium Nitrite.
Take already prepared compound from test tube stand.
Add the phenolic compound to the well cooled mixture.
A red colored substance is formed : Presence of Phenols.
Red colored substance is not formed : Absence of Phenols.
Add some Benzenesulfonyl Chloride.
Stopper the boiling tube and shake the mixture vigorously.
Test the solution ot make sure that it is still alkaline using litmus paper test.
Red litmus turnes in to blue; the Benzenesulfonyl Chloride is reacted.
Keep the solution for some time.
Add 10% HCl solution.
Presence of Aliphatic Primary Amines.
Absence of Aliphatic Primary Amines.
